com.sun.tools.visualvm.jmx

Class JmxConnectionCustomizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.properties.PropertiesProvider<Application>
      • com.sun.tools.visualvm.jmx.JmxConnectionCustomizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Positionable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultCustomizer

    public abstract class JmxConnectionCustomizer
extends PropertiesProvider<Application>
    Provider of a special JMX connection type. By registering the customizer using JmxApplicationsSupport.registerConnectionCustomizer() a new connection type is added to the Add JMX Connection dialog. If the hidesDefault flag is set for the customizer the default JMX connection type provided by VisualVM is not displayed. This is useful when the custom connection type extends the default one by adding new settings and it's not desired to present both types to the user.
    Since:
    VisualVM 1.2
    Author:
    Jiri Sedlacek

    • Constructor Detail

      • JmxConnectionCustomizer

        public JmxConnectionCustomizer(String customizerName,
                       String customizerDescription,
                       int customizerPosition,
                       boolean hidesDefault)
        Creates new instance of the JmxConnectionCustomizer. Typically only one instance of the customizer is needed, use JmxConnectionSupport.registerCustomizer to register the instance.
        Parameters:
        customizerName - name of the customizer to be displayed in the UI
        customizerDescription - optional description of the customizer, may be null
        customizerPosition - preferred position of this customizer in UI
        hidesDefault - true if the default connection type should be hidden by this customizer, false otherwise

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns an unique String identifying the JmxConnectionCustomizer. The return value is used for persistency purposes and must be constant for customizers customizing persistent JMX connections. Default implementation returns this.getClass().getName().
        Returns:
        unique String identifying the JmxConnectionCustomizer

      • getConnectionSetup

        public abstract JmxConnectionCustomizer.Setup getConnectionSetup(PropertiesPanel customizerPanel)
        Returns the Setup defining the JMX connection to be created.
        Parameters:
        customizerPanel - PropertiesPanel with the user-defined settings
        Returns:
        Setup defining the JMX connection to be created

      • providesProperties

        public boolean providesProperties(Application application)
        Returns true if the JmxConnectionCustomizer works as a PropertiesProvider for the provided Application, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        application - Application for which to provide the properties (never null)
        Returns:
        true if the JmxConnectionCustomizer works as a PropertiesProvider for the provided Application, false otherwise

      • hidesDefault

        public final boolean hidesDefault()
        Returns true if the default connection type should be hidden by this customizer, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the default connection type should be hidden by this customizer, false otherwise

      • supportsDataSource

        public final boolean supportsDataSource(Application application)
        Default implementation of the PropertiesProvider.supportsDataSource method, cannot be further overriden. JmxConnectionCustomizer always supports providing initial properties for a JMX application being created. Use the providesProperties method to control whether to provide a properties category for an existing application or not.
        Overrides:
        supportsDataSource in class PropertiesProvider<Application>
        Parameters:
        application - Application for which to provide the properites
        Returns:
        true for null Application, providesProperties(application) result otherwise

      • propertiesDefined

        public void propertiesDefined(PropertiesPanel panel,
                     Application application)
        Description copied from class: PropertiesProvider
        Called when a valid PropertiesPanel has been submitted by the user when creating a new DataSource. At this point the provider has a chance to store the properties for the DataSource. The properties should be stored into the DataSource's storage (use dataSource.getStorage()) to ensure they will be always available for persistent DataSources.
        Specified by:
        propertiesDefined in class PropertiesProvider<Application>
        Parameters:
        panel - user-submitted PropertiesPanel
        application - newly created DataSource

      • propertiesChanged

        public void propertiesChanged(PropertiesPanel panel,
                     Application application)
        Description copied from class: PropertiesProvider
        Called when a valid PropertiesPanel has been submitted by the user when editing an existing DataSource. At this point the provider has a chance to update the properties for the DataSource. The properties should be stored into the DataSource's storage (use dataSource.getStorage()) to ensure they will be always available for persistent DataSources.
        Specified by:
        propertiesChanged in class PropertiesProvider<Application>
        Parameters:
        panel - user-submitted PropertiesPanel
        application - edited existing DataSource

        public void propertiesCancelled(PropertiesPanel panel,
                       Application application)

        Called when a PropertiesPanel has been cancelled by the user. At this point the provider has a chance to perform eventual cleanup.
        Specified by:
        propertiesCancelled in class PropertiesProvider<Application>
        Parameters:
